intro: Ranunculus acris subsp. borealis, commonly known as the northern buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America and Eurasia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. The plant features bright yellow flowers with five petals and a hairy, upright stem. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a distinctive lobed structure. The subspecies is characterized by its smaller, more compact flowers compared to the typical Ranunculus acris.
